Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as b318dcaeaf0e847b6f0e2bc9365873ebe4e5dabd
Can you let me know the value of "Status" property in case the Chassis is covered and the "Rearm" is "Manual", but Redfish/IPMI-OEM set this status to "HardwareIntrusion"?

I missed this case, but I think, whatever outside sets to "Status", it should always take it as a clear/reset action and therefore "Normal". I think I will update the case of the external set call in the setSensorValue function to set "Normal" to mDBusValue and "Status" property, whatever it takes as input. Do you think this makes sense?
I changed the logic to adapt the case, instead of limiting it to setting "Normal".

This isn't how dbus enumerations are named.  They're not the literal string "Automatic".

Is there any reason you can't use the generated header file to get the C++ enumeration type?  Then you can use them as enumerations in code and let sdbusplus automatically convert them to/from dbus-strings.
It's just because I was not aware of the generated header file. Will modify it.
I changed to using the enum. I think the CI fails because it's lacking the newly defined enum from phosphor-dbus-interfaces.
It seems that the "Status" property is not updated to "HardwareIntrusion" if the chassis is intrusive and "Rearm" property is "Manual".
I think the "pRearm" is used to indicate this is a pointer parameter, but in this case, it seems that the naming is incorrect
Done
LGTM
Please address the build failure
I resolved the last failure but my patch in phosphor-dbus-interfaces is a prerequisite for this patch as it uses some enums in there, and the patch has not been merged yet.
Please specify the test cases/steps that were run to demonstrate the function for both automatic and manual arm mode
Please have a look.
Ack
@Zhikui, can you please review this from a code perspective even though the build fails?  We need the dbus interface and this to be merged in close proximity due to the dependency.

}
return;
Done
mRearmFlag = false;
Done
No need for the comment here, the if statement is clear
Done
This was placed here by the original author and the patch 13956 is still there so I leave it to wait for the author's comment.
Done
Do you think this should be eliminated?
Done
Hi, please help take a look again.
updateValue is called from both within the codebase and externally.
Hi, this function is called only internally. Instead, I see that setSensorValue() is for the purpose you mentioned.

We shouldn't be mixing phosphor-dbus-interfaces and asio here.  As written, this now imposes a hard dependency, and ports over existing code, which needs a lot more discussion if that's a change we want to make here, it needs to be looked at from a holistic standpoint.  Pulling in one two value enum doesn't seem like it would justify the dependency here.

Please follow the patterns that exist elsewhere in this repository, which will also resolve your build failure.

Is it Ok if I just simply define RearmMode as std::string? That was my first intention. I just thought over Patrick's comment (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/58205/comment/99ff4be9_fa9b4417/) and supposed that if the enum was generated, it's good to be used here.
I have changed back to use string for rearm property. Done

This is generally not how we handle this failure.  We would generally just not instanstiate the sensor if the config can't be parsed.

I think you need a continue here.
Done
have you tested change 5 here to open chassis cover?

If the chassis cover is open and the rearm action was taken, it will keep showing "Normal" until the chassis cover is closed and then opened again. So if stop 5 is "chassis cover is still open", the value will still be "Normal"
where is "Auto" handled

I missed the case. But can we assume that with "Auto", external writings will not affect the property anyway because it will be updated internally continuously? And we also don't expect it to log any fake assert de-assert event because of external writings. If so then I can change to skipping setting the property if the action is from outside in Auto mode...
Is this settable from Redfish during runtime?
My patch is under review but Redfish spec does say about writing to the Status property to rearm the sensor. My commit msg here https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/65148/10 quotes it.
Ack

Hi @Zhikui, I have a question. Since we don't use PDI's generated classes here, Status and Rearm have values without the prefix string "xyz.openbmc_project...". I wonder if they violate any rule, as both properties are defined in PDI. The maintainer from bmcweb raised question about this in my bmcweb patch but I'm not sure about how this should be. I see we have const char in SensorPaths.hpp for units (e.g constexpr const char* unitWatts = "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value.Unit.Watts";). Should the two properties in this patch be treated like this also?
Yes.  If it is an enumeration, you need the full string and not just "Automatic".
Thanks @Patrick, then I will need to update the Status property in Chassis/Intrusion.interface.yaml of PDI to use enum also, and use full string for the two properties here.
I don't believe any modification of the interface YAML is necessary.  It already has RearmMode.Automatic / RearmMode.Manual.  You just need to use the full strings in the dbus-sensors implementation.

Yeah I meant we have 2 properties here (Status and Rearm) that were defined in PDI under interface /xyz/openbmc_project/Chassis/Intrusion, but only Rearm has its enum, Status was defined as type string. So I want to change Status to use enum also.

Got it.  Yes, I agree 100%.  We should not have raw string-type properties that we're expecting other applications to pattern match against.  They should all be enumerations.

This interface was originally defined during a time when I wasn't working on the project.
Please share the PDI review link for changing status to enum
Sorry, here it is: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/65919
Thanks. Wait for it to land before +2 here
If it is a parameter for the constructor, default value on line31 is not needed
Done
why not make this a bool: auto or not auto to simplify the logic
It makes sense, thanks. Done
can we move this initialization to the constructor? That way we don't have the same string defined in two different places
Done.
PDI review https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/65919 merged
